## Chapter 1 Letter to Shareholders

Dear shareholders,

The year 2022 remained a year of political and economic instability. The ongoing war for over a year since the outbreak of the Russo-Ukrainian conflict at the beginning of the year 2022 has intensified geopolitical risks, triggered energy and food crises, and raised supply chain and labor costs. In response to inflation, the US began raising interest rates in March 2022, with a total increase of 17 basis points for the year. Inflation remains uncontrolled, and the possibility of further rate hikes adopted by the US and various countries is not excluded. However, according to the IMF's forecast, global economic growth is expected to increase from 2.7% to 2.9%, and global inflation is expected to drop from 8.8% in 2022 to 6.6% in 2023, a justification that the IMF believes that the global economy has been on an uptrend. With the efforts of all employees, AcBel's revenue has grown positively for five consecutive years from 2018 to 2022. We hereby report sincerely AcBel 's 2022 operating results and 2023 business outlook to all shareholders.

## 2022 Operating Results

The annual revenue in 2022 reached NT$25.321 billion, up by 15.6% from 2021. The annual net income in 2022 was NT$636 million and the earnings per share was NT$1.23, an increase of 5.7% compared to the same period of 2021. Although the mainland China area remained shadowed by the COVID-19 pandemic in the first three quarters of the year 2021, AcBel yet strengthened its internal epidemic prevention measures, adhered to government's laws and regulations on anti-pandemic prevention at all times, and quickly responded to reduce the impact on production. Facing the ongoing material shortages, AcBel deepened communication with our supply chains and continued to follow up on raw material supplies to ensure  stable  supply.  On  the  other  hand,  AcBel  has  continued  to  upgrade  our  level  of automation, reduce reliance on human resources, and improve operational efficiency. All these efforts  have  stabilized  customer  confidence  in  AcBel  and  fostered  win-win  cooperation through difficult times.

AcBel has been awarded a 'Gold Rating' in the sustainability assessment conducted by EcoVadis for two consecutive years, the assessment of which covers seven management indicators, across 21 sustainability criteria, in four themes: Environment, Labor & Human Rights,  Ethics  and  Sustainable  Procurement.  Moreover,    among  the  sustainability  award categories of the "TCSA Taiwan Corporate Sustainability Awards,' the largest sustainability

competition  awards  in  Taiwan,  AcBel  was  awarded  three  awards:  the  "Taiwan  Top  100 Sustainability  Model  Corporate  Award",  the  "Sustainability  Report  Category-  Electronic Information Manufacturing Industry - Category 1 Silver Award" and the "Best Performance of Specific  Categories  -  Innovative  Growth  Leader  Award"  three  sustainable  awards;  in particular, AcBel has been awarded for its sustainability reports for 8 consecutive years. Facing the impact of climate change, AcBel is committed to actively participating in various international initiatives to strive towards the goal of Net Zero. In October, 2022, AcBel finished  submitting  our  science-based  emissions  reduction  targets  to  the  Science  Based Targets initiative (SBTi). By formulating our 2030 carbon reduction targets in various scopes and pragmatically implementing the carbon reduction commitment, AcBel is dedicated to implementing the "UN's Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)' and giving full play to our positive  influence  on  sustainability,  thereby  driving  our  value  chain  towards  low-carbon transformation and actively responding to the world trend of sustainable development. For the years to come, AcBel will continue to exert our positive influence and utilize our professional core  competencies  in  power  supply  design,  renewable  energy  and  automotive  power  to achieve a vision of environmental sustainability by combining our value chain partners, including customers, supply chains, users and the like, to jointly fulfill our global citizenship responsibilities.

## Business Environment and Development Strategies

Upholding  the  commitment  of  "We  Power  the  World  with  Sustainable/Renewable Energy and High Efficiency Power Supply," AcBel will continue to create maximum value for our customers, employees, and shareholders for the years to come. By leveraging our strong research  and  development  capabilities,  AcBel  has  successfully  expanded  into  emerging applications such as green energy and electric vehicles.

## 2023 Operating Prospect

Our business direction will focus on three major areas: power supplies, electric vehicles, and green energy. The consumer power supply market is facing adjustments in the demand of terminal  markets,  with  customers  prioritizing  inventory  liquidation  in  the  short  term. However,  Acbel  will  continue  to  maintain  close  cooperation  with  customers  by  strictly controlling  inventory  and  improving  the  efficiency  of  customers'  and  our  own  internal resources usage. The enterprise power supply market will continue to grow, driven by trends in industries such as servers, data centers, fuel cells, and storage devices. Acbel's power supply products are expected to achieve a sales target of 82,533 thousand units this year.

AcBel  announced  the  acquisition  of  ABB's  Power  Conversion  Division  before  the just-passed Lunar New Year. This acquisition not only strengthens AcBel's product portfolio but  also  expands  our  customer  footprint  in  the United States while enhancing the local capabilities in research and development, manufacturing, operation, and service. Through this acquisition,  AcBel  aims  to  build  a  more  complete  and  resilient  platform  in  terminal applications such as 5G, data centers, high-performance computing, electric vehicle charging infrastructure, and warehouse automation. On top of that, AcBel is allowed to optimize our global business strategy and accelerate our progress towards becoming a solution provider.

Wish all shareholders.

Good health and good luck.

AcBel Polytech Inc.

Chairman: Hsu Chieh-Li

President: Hsu Chieh-Li

Chief Accountant: Yeh Jin-Mao

## Chapter 2 Company Profile

Established on July 29, 1981, AcBel has evolved into one of the world's leading suppliers of switching power supplies founded on sales of domestic and international electronic parts from the early stage. AcBel manufactures primarily consumer use and business use power suppliers. Driven by global warming, all countries' response to the trend of energy conservation and carbon reduction, we also take the industry-leading power management technology as our core,  actively  promoting  the  application  of  green  energy,  such  as  solar  power  plant, alternative  energy,  energy  storage  equipment,  smart  grid,  etc.  Further,  in  line  with  the industrial trend of vehicle electrification and intellectualization, we have also invested in the field of electric vehicle power.

The manufacturing bases of AcBel are located in Taiwan, China and the Philippines. The Company has continued to operate in response to customer ordering demands and industrial trend with  timely  production  capacity  expansions.    AcBel  also  promotes  precise manufacturing and utilizes flexible and comprehensive production network to meet the needs of global customers.    At the same time, we have set up service stations in the United States, Europe, China, Japan and other locations, so as to provide a variety of services within the proximity of our clients and promptly satisfy their needs.    With our global R&D headquarter located in Taiwan and also professional R&D teams in China and the United States, we grasp the market trends in advance and meet customer needs, conduct forward-looking technology research and product developments, so that we are ready to provide products with high efficiency and high quality on demand.

## I. Date of incorporation

July 29, 1981.

## II. Evolution history of the Company

Important events during the most recent year and up to the publication date of the annual report are as follows:

## 2021

-  The full election held at AcBel's regular shareholders' meeting changed one third of directors. Mr. Hsu Chieh-Li serves as the chairman of the new board, an important milestone for the generational handover.
-  AcBel received the 3 rd National Enterprise Environmental Protection Award - Silver

- Award from the Environmental Protection Administration, Executive Yuan
-  AcBel received a Top 50 Corporate Sustainability Award in the 14 th Taiwan Corporate Sustainability Award (TCSA).
-  AcBel received the Electronic Information Manufacturing - Platinum Award in the 14 th Taiwan Corporate Sustainability Award (TCSA).
-  AcBel received the 2021 TCSA Taiwan Sustainability Action Award (TSAA) - Silver Award.
-  AcBel  received  '2021  Buying  Power  -  Social  Innovation  Products  and  Services Procurement - Support Award' by Ministry of Economic Affairs, R.O.C. (Taiwan).
-  AcBel passed the TCFD Performance Assessment Statement - Pioneer Level, the highest level rated by SGS.
-  AcBel received Outstanding Serviceability Award from LENOVO.
-  AcBel  Electronic  (WUHAN)  Co.,  Ltd.  received  the  2020  Best  Service  Award  from Hangzhou Hikvision Digital Technology Co., Ltd. (HIK VISION).
-  AcBel Electronic (Dong Guan) Co., Ltd. received 2020 Outstanding Supplier Award from Zhejiang Dahua Technology Co., Ltd. (DAHUA).
-  AcBel invested in and established AcTel Power Co., Ltd..

## 2022

-  Honored with 2021 Best Innovation Award by VIVO Mobile CommunicationCo., Ltd
-  Received three sustainability honors - Taiwan Top 100 Sustainability Model Corporate Award, Sustainability Report Category- Electronic Information Manufacturing Industry Category 1 Silver Award, and Best Performance of Specific Categories - Innovative Growth  Leader  Award;  in  which  the  sustainability  report  has  won  the  award  for  8 consecutive years.
-  AcBel has been recognized by EcoVadis Sustainability Rating with 'Gold Medal' for two consecutive years.

## 2023

-  Groundbreaking ceremony for the new construction of Kinpo Group headquarter.
-  Announced  the  acquisition  of  Power  Conversion  division  of  ABB  Group  from Switzerland.

## 5. Board diversity and independence:

The Company's current Board of Directors is composed of 10 Directors, including three Independent  Directors.  The  nomination  and  selection  of  the  board  members  shall  be conducted in accordance with the provisions of the Articles of Incorporation, adopting the candidate nomination system, in compliance with the Election Procedures of Directors and the  Corporate  Governance  Practice  Principles,  so  as  to  ensure  the  diversity  and independence of Directors.

## (1) Board diversity

Except for the number of Directors who are concurrently managers of the Company shall not exceed one-third of all Directors, the composition of the Board of Directors shall  be  determined  based  on  the  Company's  business  operations,  operating dynamics, and development needs. The policy should include, without being limited to, the following two general standards:

- A. Basic requirements and values: Gender, age, nationality, and culture.
- B.  Professional knowledge and skills: A professional background (e.g., finance, accounting, operation, investment and M&A, risk management), professional skills, and industry experience.

In accordance with Chapter 3 of the Company's Corporate Governance Practice Principles - Strengthen the functions of the Board of Directors, each board member shall have the necessary knowledge, skill, and experience to perform their duties. In order to achieve the ideal objective of corporate governance, the abilities that must be present in the board as a whole are as follows:

- A. The ability to make judgments about operations.
- B. Accounting and financial analysis ability.
- C. Business management ability.
- D. Crisis management ability.
- E. Knowledge of the industry.
- F. An international market perspective.
- G. Leadership ability.
- H. Decision-making ability.

The current board members of the Company all have relevant experience in the same industry and management ability. However, in order to ensure the sustainable operation of the Company, the composition of the Board of Directors shall be mainly based on expertise and complementarity in each sector, followed by gender and age, and will be focused on the younger age and gender diversity

in the future. The diversity of board members is as follows:

## (V) Where the Company has any of the following circumstances, the remuneration of Individual Directors shall be disclosed:

- 1. Where the Company has posted after-tax deficits in the parent company only financial reports or individual financial reports within the three most recent fiscal years, it shall disclose the remuneration paid to Individual Directors. This requirement, however, shall not apply if the Company has posted net income after tax in the parent company only financial report or individual financial report for the most recent fiscal year and such net income after tax is sufficient to offset the accumulated deficits: None.
- 2. Where  the  Company  has  had  an  insufficient  Director  shareholding  percentage  for  3 consecutive  months  or  longer  during  the  most  recent  fiscal  year,  it  shall  disclose  the remuneration of individual Directors: None.
- 3. Where the Company has had an average ratio of share pledging by Directors in excess of 50 percent in any 3 months during the most recent fiscal year, it shall disclose the remuneration paid to each Director having a ratio of pledged shares in excess of 50 percent for each such month: None.
- 4. - 2. Remuneration policies, standards, and packages, the procedure for determining remuneration, and its linkage to operating performance and future risk exposure:
- (1) According to the provisions of the Articles of Incorporation, if the Company makes profits for the year, it shall set aside no more than 2% of the pre-tax profits of the current period before the deduction of employee remuneration and Director remuneration as Directors' remuneration, and pay  reasonable  remuneration  to  Directors  taking  into  account  the  operating  results  of  the Company and their contribution to the Company's performance.
- (2) In accordance with the Company's compensation policy, the remuneration paid to managers of the Company shall be based on the salary level of the position in the same industry, the scope of responsibility of such position within the Company and the contribution to their company's operational objectives.
- (3) In accordance with the Company's procedures for determining remuneration, remuneration shall be paid on a reasonable basis by taking into account the overall operating performance of the Company, the individual's performance achievement and contribution to the Company's performance. The relevant remuneration shall be submitted to the Remuneration Committee for review and the Board of Directors for resolution. The Company also monitors the changes in the global economy, the international financial environment and the industrial climate at any time to predict the Company's future operation development, profit situation and operation risks, as well as changes in relevant laws and regulations, and reviews the remuneration system on a timely basis to strike a balance between the Company's sustainable operation and risk control.

## ■ Rights and interests of employees and care for employees

Under  the  vision  of  "happy  enterprise",  our  mission  is  to  create  a  healthy  and  safe  working environment and a happy and growth and learning space for our employees. We treat and respect every employee fairly, and provide all statutory or even superior employee benefits, including but not limited  to  work  interests,  compensation  and  benefits,  insurance  care,  leave  benefits,  care  for employees, health promotion and other measures. In order to achieve the vision of "happy enterprise", the Company operates according to the flying geese theory, emphasizing four aspects of "team cooperation,  leadership  in  turn,  encouraging  peers  and  mutual  support",  and  implementing  four actions of "warmness, attitude, tolerance and positivity", so as to establish a good corporate culture, motivate and stimulate employees' potential and creativity, and achieve the energy for positive cycles of sustainability.

- ■ Implementation of risk management policies and risk measurement standards
-  Risk management policies and procedures

The Company established the Risk Management Procedures on August 15, 2007 and amended it in 2020 as the Risk Management Policies and Procedures in order to achieve the Company's strategic objectives and sustainable operation.

The Company takes the Risk Management Policies and Procedures as the highest guiding principle of the Company's risk management, periodically assesses risks annually, identifies and analyzes risks that the Company may face in advance, and then take advance control measures and continuous monitoring and improvement procedures to minimize the possibility of potential risks and minimize the impact on the Company's objectives.

##  Risk management scope

The Company takes precautionary measures in advance to reduce the losses caused by risks. The responsible unit addresses the risks that may harm the Company's operation due to the international situation, climate change, the overall economy, legal changes and other factors, such as: strategic risks, financial risks, operational risks, hazard risks or other possible hazards that may affect the daily operation of the Company, conducts risk management according to the identifying, evaluating, processing and monitoring procedures to control the risks arising from the Company's business activities to an acceptable extent, assesses the frequency of risk events and the impact on the Company's operations based on the risk matrix, identifies the risk level and priorities, and formulates formulate corresponding management policies.

## ■ Implementation of customer policies

##  Satisfy reasonable customer requirements:

The Company is a professional design foundry for power supply products, stepping into the field of energy integration services, solar power generation, and EV power, with its proficient and  professional  power  supply  technology.  The  Company's  clients  include  world-class international brand companies, with the requirement to comply with the laws and regulations, rules of international alliances and codes of conduct for customers, including safeguarding labor & human rights, fair treatment of employees, implementing ethical management, and improving corporate social responsibility norms such as environmental protection, safety and health. The Company's actions have been duly met with customer requirements and relevant audits. To address the requirements from customers regarding climate change, carbon reduction pathways and use of renewables, the Company has been implementing greenhouse gas accounting and verification  and  environmental  projects  such  as  TCFD  (Task  Force  on  Climate-Related Financial Disclosures), CDP (Carbon Disclosure Project) and SBTi (Science Based Targets initiative).

##  Introduce green cycle:

The  Company  sets  "provide  a  completely  green  solution,  become  the  best  partner  of cutting-edge environmental energy" as its business vision, will be "to become the top two power supplier in the global power supply industry" as its development goal. In addition to designing and  manufacturing  stable,  high-quality,  safe  and  green  power  products,  the  Company  will develop towards upstream of the supply chain in the future to create an innovative energy aggregation  service  business  model:  electricity  generation,  power  transfer,  electricity consumption,  electricity  storage,  aggregation  service,  etc.  By  leveraging  its  power  supply technology, the Company has been developing automobile power control systems from starting, charging,  shunting,  to  DCDC  conversion  for  both  electric  two-wheelers  and  electric four-wheelers, as well as devoting in the research and development and sales of green power. This diversification aims to boost the Company's total revenues.

The Company will introduce the green cycle (green design → green  procurement → green manufacturing  process → green  packaging → green  transportation)  fully  into  the  product manufacturing process, produce environmental protection and energy-saving product with the improvement  of  its  own  research  and  development  technology,  to  meet  the  needs  and expectations of customers and consumers for power products with a comprehensive quality approach.

##  Customer satisfaction survey:

Customer satisfaction is the core value of the Company, and we attach importance to the views and opinions of customers. Department of dedicated business, customer service and quality assurance  carry  out  customer  satisfaction  surveys  through  monthly  or  quarterly  customer management meetings and the semi-annual rating on product quality, service quality, delivery quality,  price  quality,  technical  capability  and  overall  satisfaction,  to  understand  their recognition or criticism on the Company as a reference for improvement in a timely manner. Its statistical  comprehensive  survey  results  have  been  highly  recognized  by  customers  for consecutive years.

## ■ Intellectual Property Management:

In order to establish the competitive advantage of products, enhance the brand image, improve the corporate profits, and avoid the loss caused by infringement, the Company's dedicated department has developed an intellectual property management system aligned with business objectives. The purpose is  to  connects  R&D  resources  with  business  expansion  needs  and  to  ensure  the  Company's

profitability.

-  Patent-related management and protection measures:

The Company has established a reward system for the patent application, encourages R&D personnel to make creative proposals, and assists and tracks patent output for key R&D projects under the product roadmap for the future. Before each application is submitted, the Company carries out the patent literature retrieval process first to understand the prior technical status, strengthens the technical content and discussion of its own patent application. The Company has set up a patent application review committee to receive suggestions by grading, evaluation and discussion, so as to strengthen the quality of the application proposal again.

The  Company  establishes  the  patent  roadmap,  collects,  monitors  and  analyzes  the  patent application  status  of  other  companies  in  the  same  industry,  classifies  the  patent  roadmap according to the technical content and technical feature, so as to establish a technical matrix roadmap, and identify the part without legal risk as the design reference manual for the R&D personnel,  and  strengthen  the  research  and  development  energy.  For  the  right  of  patent announcement suspected of infringement, the Company will conduct previous case retrieval and review history analysis, build profiles and control, and discuss with the R&D personnel, so as to avoid infringement at the design stage and prevent the Company from suffering losses.

##  Trade secret management and protection measures:

The Company stipulates the confidentiality obligation of company secrets, prohibited disclosure or use of the trade secrets owned by the former employer and other provisions in the employee employment contract. The Company files confidential technical documents in the document control center and manages the rights to download, copy and access documents, which is traceable. Access control is set up in important areas. The non-disclosure agreement (NDA) is required to be signed by all the relevant manufacturers.

-  Trademark management and protection measures:

The  Company  regularly  reviews  the  market  expansion  plan  with  relevant  personnel,  and actively engages in the operation and product sales of nationally registered company trademark.

-  Copyright management and protection measures:

The Company stores important technical related works such as circuit diagram and organization diagram in the document control center or R&D center, with the implementation of access control and flow tracking, and encrypts internal computer files with the implementation of access control and flow tracking.

Please  refer  to  the  Company's  website/Investors  Section/Corporate  Governance  Section (http://www.acbel.com)  for  information  on  the  implementation  of  intellectual  property management of the Company.

## Notes:

■

Governance structure for sustainable development:

The  Sustainable  Development  Committee  of  the  Company  is  established  under  the  Board  of Directors, in which the Independent Directors are primarily responsible for the guidance on the sustainable development direction.  And the Company's management team is coordinated by the President. The committee is divided into five functional groups to be responsible for the formulation

and  implementation  of  sustainable  development  strategies,  including  the  promotion  of  social responsibility policies, systems and related management guidelines, as well as corporate governance. The Company has also set up the Corporate Sustainability Office as the coordinating window to collect  information  on  the  sustainable  development,  climate  change  and  energy  conservation  & emission reduction trends at home and abroad on a regular basis, such as environmental, social and corporate governance (ESG), corporate social responsibility (CSR) and issues that the stakeholders are concerned about, providing strategic references for the operational management and the Board of Directors. The Company reports to the Board of Directors on the outcome of communicating with stakeholders, sustainability trends and the effectiveness of the specific initiatives and implementation results  at  least  once  a  year,  and  discloses  the  sustainability  implementation  performance  to stakeholders by announcing on the Market Observation Post System (MOPS), the Company's website and Corporate Sustainability Reports in accordance with government regulations. Please refer to the Company's website and Corporate Sustainability Reports for the related promotion performance of sustainability (http://www.acbel.com).

<!-- image -->

The functions of the Corporate Social Responsibility Committee are as follows:

-  Board of Directors: responsible for supervising the promotion direction and implementation of ESG.
-  President:  coordinate  the  ESG  strategies,  supervising  the  implementation  of  plans  and performance evaluation.
-  Each functional group: responsible for the planning of ESG, and submitting them to the meeting for discussion and resolution, and implementation.
-  Corporate  Sustainable  Development  Office:  collection  of  the  latest  domestic  and  overseas information on ESG, climate change, energy efficiency and carbon reduction and the issues pertinent to stakeholders; and disclosure of the information on the Company's relevant actions and responses
-  Global  plant:  Integrate  sustainable  solutions  into  local  daily  operations  according  to  the resolution requirements of the operation headquarters, and ensure that the objectives are met or even exceeded through a PDCA cycle of Plan, Do, Check and Act.
- ■ Rights  of  stakeholders  and  communication  and  disclosure  channels  of  corporate  sustainable development:

## (IX) Implementation State of the Internal Control System

- 1. Internal Control Statement

## AcBel Polytech Inc. Statement on Internal Control System

Date: March 8, 2023

According to the self-evaluation results of the internal control system by the Company in 2022, we hereby state as follows:

- I. The  Company's  Board  of  Directors  and  management  are  responsible  for  establishing, implementing, and maintaining an adequate internal control system, and such a system has been established. The purpose of establishing the internal control system is to reasonably assure the following objectives: (a) The effectiveness and efficiency of business operation (including earnings,  operation  performance  and  the  safeguard  of  company  assets);  (b)  the  reliability, timeliness, transparency of report; and (c) Achieve compliance objectives according to the relevant laws and regulations in order to provide reasonable assurances.
- II. Due to the innate limitation in designing a faultless internal control system, this system can only assure the reasonableness of the above three objectives has been fairly achieved. In addition, the effectiveness of the internal control system could alter over time due to the change of business environment or situation. Since the Company's internal control system is provided with a self-monitoring mechanism, the Company will take corrective actions in response to any identified deficiencies.
- III. The evaluation of the effectiveness of the internal control system design and implementation is made in accordance with the Guidelines for the Establishment of Internal Control Systems by Public Companies (the Guidelines). The Guidelines are made to examine the following five factors  during  the  management  and  control  process:  (1)  control  environment,  (2)  risk assessment and response, (3) control activities, (4) information and communication, and (5) supervision. Each factor also includes several items. Please refer to the Guidelines for the preceding items.
- IV. The Company has examined the effectiveness of each respected area in the internal control system based on the Guidelines.
- V. V. Based on the findings of such evaluation, the Company believes that, on December 31, 2022, it has maintained, in all material respects, an effective internal control system (including the supervision and management of our subsidiaries), to provide reasonable assurance over our operational effectiveness and efficiency, reliability, timeliness, transparency of reporting, and compliance with applicable laws, regulations and bylaws.
- VI. This Statement is a significant part of the Company's annual report and prospectus available to the general public. If any of the disclosed contents above contains false information or omits any material content, the Company will involve legal liability under Article 20, Article 32, Article 171 and Article 174 set forth in the Security and Exchange Act.
- VII. The Company hereby declares that this statement had been adopted by the Board of Directors on March 8, 2023. Among the 10 attending Directors, 0 Director raised any objection and all consented to the content expressed in this Statement.

## (VI) Company's Dividend Policy and Implementation thereof

- 1. Dividend policy adopted in the Company's Articles of Incorporation
- In accordance with Article 26-1 of the Articles of Incorporation, if there are any earnings after the Company's annual closing of the books, the Company shall first pay all taxes and dues and cover accumulated losses, then appropriate 10% of the earnings as the statutory surplus reserve; provided that this restriction shall not apply if the statutory surplus reserve has reached the paid-in capital of the Company. The Company shall make provision or reversal for special surplus reserve from the remaining earnings as required by law or by the provisions of competent authorities. If there is still a balance, the Board of Directors shall draw up an earnings distribution plan for the balance and the undistributed  retained  earnings  at  the  beginning  of  the  period,  and  submit  it  to  the  board  of shareholders for a resolution on distribution.
- The Company may authorize the Board of Directors to distribute dividends and bonuses, capital reserves or statutory surplus reserves payable in cash in whole or in part by a resolution of a majority vote at a meeting of the Board of Directors attended by two-thirds or more of the total number of Directors, and report to the shareholders' meeting.
- The Company is at a stage of steady growth. In consideration of the Company's future capital needs and to meet the needs of shareholders for cash inflows, the annual cash dividend paid shall not be less than 50% of the total cash and stock dividends paid in the current year if there are earnings available for distribution after the Company's annual closing of the books.
- 2. Dividend distributions proposed at the Shareholders' Meeting
- In accordance with the Articles of Incorporation, the Company may authorize the Board of Directors to distribute dividends and bonuses payable in cash in whole or in part by a resolution of a majority vote at a meeting of the Board of Directors attended by two-thirds or more of the total number of Directors, and report to the shareholders' meeting.
- The Company's cash dividends distributed from earnings in 2022 have been passed by the Board of Directors on March 8, 2023. The shareholder dividends distributed from earnings is NT$105,220,259, which was paid in cash in NT$0.2 per share.
- The Board of Directors shall authorize the chairman to handle the current cash dividend distributed from earnings discretionarily if the number of outstanding shares is subsequently affected by the Company's repurchase or recovery of its own shares, cancellation of the share capital or other factors, resulting in changes in the shareholders' allocation ratio which need to be corrected.
- 3. An explanation for any expected material changes in the dividend policy: None.

## 1. The Company's Major lines of Business

As one of the top ten leading manufacturers of switching power supply in the world, AcBel Polytech Inc. is mainly engaged in the research and development, production and sales of power supply, which accounts  for  about  90%  of  the  total  sales.  With  professional  design  and  rich  manufacturing experience, the Company provides customers with high efficiency and energy-saving products and complete power management solutions.

Main products consist of (1) consumer use power suppliers: applied to desktop computers, notebook computers, smart phones, smart home appliances, and others; (2) business use power suppliers: applied to servers, storage devices, networking and telecommunication, and others.    In addition, the Company is also actively expanding its developments in green energy, electric vehicles, and other emerging terrains.    The Company has also long been dedicated in the fundamentals of designing and manufacturing power suppliers.    In coordination with the global trend of international clean energies and government energy policies, the Company officially entered the industry of solar power plants (stations) in Taiwan in 2017.    As of the end of 2022, the Company has already obtained (including completion of establishment) a scale of approximately 150MWp of solar plants, hoping that this relatively  new  business  will  collaboratively  create  synergy  along  with  the  Company's  founding business in the power industry.

## (II) Industrial Overview

- 1. The Current Status and Development of the Industry
- (1) Power Supply Industry

The Power Supply is designed to provide stable power supply with appropriate voltage or current for electronic products, and is one of the indispensable functional components. According to the different functions and basic structure of products, it can be divided into two categories: Linear Power Supply (LPS) and Switching Power Supply (SPS).

The advantages to use SPS include providing products with low loss, small volume, lightweight, which  is  in  line  with  the  development  trend  of  light,  thin  and  short  terminal  products  and energy-saving and environmental protection, and providing a wider range of external imputable voltages  than  an  LPS,  and  providing  the  performance  of  higher  power  density/conversion efficiency, all of which contribute to wider application scope. The scope of products includes chargers, rectifiers, converters, inverters and an Uninterrupted Power System (UPS).

Currently,  Taiwan's  SPS  manufacturers  are  facing  low-price  competitions  from  Chinese manufacturers within the personal computer and consumer electronic device charger markets; the environment is dire.    During the first three quarters in 2022, as material shortage was ameliorated, and as clients' orders were finally smoothly delivered after large amounts of backlogs occurred due to supply chain issues during the pandemic, we have finally welcomed prosperity in growth that has been unseen for many years.  However, during the fourth quarter, under the influence of clients' inventory backlogs and inflation, the overall industry showed declines varying from 20% to 30%; and the market outlook is still unclear.  With respect to application of the information center, as material shortage in 2022 has been ameliorated, deliveries in the first three quarters have also largely increased.  After the fourth quarter, following the concerns of rising interest rates, inflation, and economic recession, cloud customers grew conservative in capital expenditure and gradually  cancelled  or  postponed  information  center  expansion  plans;  service  lives  of  the equipment have also been extended.    Prospect for 2023 is also tending towards conservative - it is estimated that the market will only show single-digit growth.    In terms of development of 5G, the market  poses  relatively  strong  demands  on  edge  computing  servers  and  networking  and telecommunication products as a result of the tender opening of C-BAND in North America in 2021, expansions and needs for equipment changes by telecommunication companies, as well as the  Biden  government's  investment  in  fundamental  broadband  internet  infrastructures  per Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. Under risk-avoidance constraint posed by the U.S.- China trade war, most clients are transitioning their orders to Taiwan and Southeast Asian countries. Taiwan, being an island of technology, carries its advanced semiconductor manufacturing capabilities, and the fully supported supply chains are thus able to respond to all emerging industries by offering comprehensive resolution  plans. ## (3) Electric Vehicle Industry

With the rapid development of battery and automobile technology, it is possible to replace gasoline with electricity as the main source of power for vehicles. Electric vehicles are vehicles that use batteries as energy storage and power supply and are driven by motors. Electric vehicles can be divided into BEVs (battery electric vehicles), HEVs (hybrid electric vehicles), PHEVs (plug-in hybrid electric vehicles) and REEVs (extended range electric vehicles) according to different power supply methods and ratio. In addition, there are other vehicles, such as fuel cell vehicles or solar cell vehicles, that can generate energy on their own.

From the Kyoto Protocol, the Paris Agreement, to the United Nations Climate Change Conference, led by European countries, countries around the world have begun to have constructive discussions and systematic measurement standards on environmental protection issues, especially on tracking and measuring greenhouse gas emissions, use of renewable energy, energy efficiency and climate policy. The current global carbon emission target is 40% reduction from 2015 to 2025, among which the European vehicle target of 59 grams of carbon dioxide per kilometer in 2030 is the most stringent. Governments have also gradually issued timetables for banning the sale of fuel vehicles. For example, Norway and the Netherlands are expected to completely ban the sale of new fuel vehicles in 2025; and Germany will only approve license for zero-carbon vehicles after 2030, and have internal combustion engine (ICE) banned on the road after 2050. Japan has raised its 2030 carbon reduction target from 26% to 46%, and will ban the sale of fuel vehicles in 2035. In response to these carbon reduction policies, large car manufacturers have increased the proportion of electric vehicles in their product lines in order to meet the deadline and limits of carbon emissions in various countries.

In 2022, benefited from major countries' national policies supporting development of new energy vehicles, successive innovative and traditional vehicle manufacturers, and easing of impact from pandemic lockdowns, number of electric vehicles sales globally reached approximately 10.12 million in 2022.

Entering 2023, following the dominant trend of electrification and the ameliorating of material shortage, along with the densely successive launch of new electric vehicles globally, the expected number of vehicles sold may reach 13.68 million with an annual growth rate of 35%.    In 2025, number of electric vehicles sold globally is anticipated to exceed 23 million, which in response to electrification penetration rate via statistics may translate to a growth rate of 30%.    And an annual compound growth rate of 30% is still able to be maintained for the next three years.    Observing from mid- and long-term perspectives, electric vehicle market is expected to continue expanding at a rapid pace.

According to the Global EV Outlook released by the International Energy Agency (IEA), the number of electric vehicles, electric buses, electric lorries and electric trucks is expected to reach 145 million in 2030. The IEA believes that the number of electric vehicles in the world will continue to increase and is expected to reach 230 million in the next 10 years with vigorous promotion of international energy and climate goals by the governments around the world.

## 3. Trends of Products

Taiwan's SPS product development can be divided into two aspects: 1) the technology development is towards the field of high efficiency, multiple input voltage, wider operating temperature, intelligence. The  equipment  traditionally  used  in  data  centers,  including  servers,  Networking  and  Telecom equipment for enterprises, and storage equipment, is also being applied to the communications room and  base  station  environment.  Modular  design  is  adopted  for  products,  parallel  stacking  mode (500W+500W+...) is applied, the application range of products is expanded (low-end, mid-end and high-end power), all of which has significantly shortened the product development cycle; 2) the product is developed as light, thin, short and small. The main market is the consumer end of cloud

computing, such as smart mobile phones, notebook computers, tablet computers, etc., and small power suppliers applied in 3C products. Looking forward to the future, the market demand for small, light, energy-saving and low-cost products will continue to increase. With the adoption of smart and portable communication products in large numbers, the appearance of the products becomes smaller and thinner, with the advantages of being portable. End-users have to connect with the cloud through the network and service providers who provide information with computing capacity, which directly stimulates the cloud service providers to build a large number of data centers. Under the convergence environment of 5G data and communication, both Telecom operators and network service providers must  actively  expand  network  equipment  to  meet  the  needs  of  users  and  AIoT  equipment  for information services, which will promote the growth of the market and form a virtuous cycle. Cloud data center server, Networking and Telecom equipment and consumer electronics products have become the most important application market for SPS.

Global development of power suppliers for desktop personal computer use has already been highly mature.  The first three quarters in 2022 were benefited from improvement of material shortage during the pandemic and manufacturers' smooth order deliveries as backlogs due to port congestion were ameliorated, bringing prosperous growth that has not been seen for many years.  However, after the fourth quarter, the market rapidly entered recession due to backlogs at endpoint inventories, causing an unclear overall market outlook. The high level of standardization has forced desktop PC vendor manufacturers to expand their market share through price competition that drives down costs and mass production capacity. On the other hand, the market acceptance for beautiful and convenient All In One computer is increasing. Despite the recession, the market is still growing faster than traditional  desktop  PCs.  In  addition  to  basic  applications,  e-sports  PC  requires  stable  dynamic responses and high-power output as a result of adopting high-efficiency GPU for lots of computing, and there is still room for growth in power supplies for such special applications.

The  technology  of  power  supplies  for  personal  computers  extends  upward  to  servers,  large Networking,  Telecom  equipment  and  storage  devices.  With  the  rapid  development  of  cloud computing, mid-end and low-end servers tend to be matured after years of rapid growth in recent years. Although the technology, complexity and stability of the power supply applied in servers are higher  than  those  applied  in  PC  power  supply,  as  servers  move  towards  a  standardized  single architecture, the power supply also moves towards standardization due to the high commercialization of the mid-end and low-end systems. As a result, it is difficult for manufacturers to increase unit prices through differentiation. Therefore, in order to reduce the overall development cost, it tends to adopt the standardized design for power supply and reduce the number of parts and automatic production to improve the reliability.

In response to the large number of servers deployed in a single location by the data center, the product tends  to  gradually  shift  from  continuous  efficiency  improvement  of  a  single  power  supply  to systematic optimization of smart power management and cabinet power architecture, enhance the power factor of power supply and reduce total harmonic distortion through the introduction of digital control. In recent years, with production and R&D bases of servers, large Networking and Telecom equipment and storage equipment moving to China and Taiwan, Taiwan power supply manufacturer actively  developing  their  design  capabilities  with  relatively  lower  price  pressure  compared  to European, American and Japanese manufacturers, power supplies for mid-end and low-end servers, large Networking and Telecom equipments and storage equipments have been mainly designed and manufactured by Taiwan manufacturers. The server power supply market is becoming mature due to the advances in virtualization and cloud computing technology and the rise of distributed power architecture. The market for dedicated storage devices has also been hit by Intel-Based storage servers and cloud storage solutions. Under the decline of terminal application, the growth momentum of the market has shifted to Networking and Telecom equipment as the focus. Base on the AIOT's edge computing requirements and as it is expected to adopt a large number of IT servers and Networking and Telecom equipment for 5G infrastructure, the IT system and power supply in line with the environmental  standards  of  telecommunications  equipment  and  computer  room  will  drive  the development of a new generation of products in the future.

Power  supply  for  communication  mostly  adopts  Distributed  Power  Architecture,  which  usually consists of an AC-DC Rectifier supplying the busbar voltage and a DC/DC Converter at the later stage. Such kinds of products are of high technology and with great importance attaching to product reliability. On the whole structure, it can reduce costs and improve efficiency by reducing the times of

power  conversion.  The  rectifier  sector  also  develops  toward  high  efficiency,  high  density.  In consideration of costs of DC-DC converter at the later stage, traditional high-end isolated converters tend to be replaced by non-isolated converters (POLs) with lower cost. For bus bar voltage, with the rise of new energy sources and the application of data centers, more efficient HVDC systems sprung up in the market. The emergence of different architectures and applications is expected to create new growth momentum in the highly standardized telecommunications power supply market.

Given the rising awareness about environmental protection, the opposition of nuclear and the call for phasing out nuclear, the pursuit of zero carbon, the reduction use of fossils fuels and the increase of green energy contribute to the growing importance of electricity grid stability and the efficient use of energy.      Smart  meters  may  enable  power  companies  to  keep  track  of  trends  in  electricity consumption in a timely manner and dispatch limited power resources more efficiently. Replacing the traditional meters in every household with smart meters with communication function is the most basic and important step, which is also a necessary step.

Energy management services can inject new energy into all energy products. In addition to smart meters, if all kinds of grid-connected power generation devices, energy storage systems, renewable energy power plants or related products can be introduced through energy management system (EMS) and demand control technology, the sales value of products in the power supply market can be doubled.

With  the  popularity  of  cloud  computing  and  big  data  applications,  data  centers  are  becoming large-scale, which also leads to a significant increase in the purchase of relevant power systems. OCP (Open Compute Project, initiated by Facebook, etc.), ODCC (Open Data Center Committee, initiated by BAT), Open19 (Open Data Center, initiated by LinkedIn) and other open computing organizations are playing a major role in driving innovation in the data center field, all of which have come up with a reference specification for modular cabinet design. In consideration of standardized cabinet design is a trend in the design of power converters applied for data centers, the design of modular converter module and expandable cabinet is proposed, which will enable the related products to meet the functional requirements of major data center manufacturers.

About the EV industry, the supply chain has undergone tremendous changes after Tesla launched platform-based and modular production. Take the electric vehicle electronic control field covered by the company as an example, it has gradually moved from individual components (such as on-board chargers, motor controllers, DC converters) to an integrated design (all-in-one electronic control products). The integrated design enables the design of the mechanism and the appearance to be shared to achieve a miniaturized design and increase the power density. To improve the mileage and charging speed of electric vehicles, battery modules and electronic control systems continue to evolve towards 800V high voltage. The 800V high voltage platform launched by Porsche is marking the start of high voltage era. For the batteries in electric vehicles, mainstream electric vehicles manufacturers around the world use high energy density lithium batteries as an important driving force for expanding the territory of electric vehicles. However, even though the prospects of lithium batteries are promising, the market still hopes to develop new batteries that have higher energy density and higher safety that lithium batteries because numerous charge and discharge can easily affect the lifespan of lithium batteries and there are concerns for inflammation. Among them, the development of solid-state batteries and fuel cells has received the most attention. The development of electronic vehicle motors is also moving towards integration. Motor, transmissions and motor controllers are integrated and combined with artificial intelligence and big data for control.

According to the analysis, the main customers of in-vehicle products of electric vehicles are from America  and  Japan,  and  their  models  are  primarily  sold  in  American  and  Asia.  The  principal competitor in Taiwan is Delta Electronics. Facing the huge business opportunities in the electric vehicle market, we are in a very favorable position. With the launch of all-in-one integrated products, the application of next-generation compound semiconductors and the continuous accumulation of R&D technologies, the automotive products are expected to have a long-term growth. However, attention should be paid to the shortage of components and long delivery time of semiconductors.

## 4. Competition

Taiwan is a major producer of information products in the world. Driven by downstream industries, Taiwan ranks first in global shipments of power supplies. In recent years, due to the impact of the PC industry being hit by the rise of low-cost computers, tablets and smartphones, the competition from

Chinese manufacturers at low prices, and the global economic downturn for several years, the prices of power supply products have been declining year by year, and the manufacturers' gross margins are not good as they used to be. However, with the increasing demand for energy-saving and carbon reduction in various countries, the conversion efficiency of power supply and power management function has become the focus of customer requirements. In recent years, the concept of smart electricity consumption has attracted more attention from all countries. Energy saving and effective use of energy has become one of the key requirements of competing products from all countries. Smart meters are the first step to implement smart power grids. How to effectively capture the data that users need from meters has become an important issue. In addition, the application of data captured by meters is also of great importance, and many enterprises have begun to invest resources in research and development in this market. Under the development of industry standards and the successive  formulation  of  product  specifications,  various  major  manufacturers  have  launched  a complete series of products. The thresholds for R&D design, manufacturing capability and cost control have also been raised.

Furthermore, large cloud service companies and data center operators, and new types of applications such  as  edge  computing  systems  for  5G  infrastructure,  define  hardware  through  software  and introduce the concept of open hardware standards, which will not only continue to change the traditional  data  center  equipment,  but  will  also  impact  the  supply  pattern  and  demand  of telecommunications equipment. They, together with Telecom providers and data centers, purchased a huge amount of servers, Networking and Telecom equipment and storage, and went beyond the traditional brand vendors and directly to Asia to seek customized products from ODM manufacturers according to specific requirements, which caused a certain impact on the supply chain of traditional commercial information equipment. As a key component of the power supply industry, it is necessary to readjust the product strategy and design production mode in the new supply chain pattern, and seize the opportunity to seek a new position.

Besides, due to China's manpower shortage and the risk of the US-China trade war, in order to maintain  lower  manufacturing  costs  and  improve  price  competitiveness,  and  quickly  launch energy-saving products that meet the market demand, and reduce the risk of single manufacturing site,  domestic  SPS  manufacturers  have  also  set  up  factories  in  Thailand,  Malaysia,  India,  the Philippines and other places, shortened the development  cycle  through  internal design standardization, and improved the automation productivity of mid-end and low-end products. In the past few years, the global power supply industry has been moving towards integration through consolidation  and  the  elimination  of  a  number  of  small  factories  in  the  face  of  fierce  market competition. However, there is still no single player to dominate the market, with the big Taiwanese players competing against each other. The conditions of each competitor are different, so the medium and above-sized companies in the market still have their own room for growth and development due to the difference in product positioning, and the advantages in manufacturing and R&D capabilities.

The Company does not expect to incur such expenditure in future years.

We attach importance to the implementation of the concept of environmental protection and plant safety and health, and actively invest in various environmental expenditure, through the plan, do, check  and  action  of  the  PDCA  cycle,  to  ensure  the  achievement  of  environmental  protection objectives  and  measures,  and  further  promote  continuous  improvement,  to  fulfill  the  social responsibility of environmental and energy sustainability. - 3. Retirement System and Its Implementation

The Company has established a Retirement Measures for Employees covering all formal staff. In accordance with the provisions of the Labor Standards Act, the Company shall set aside 3.5% of the total payroll on a monthly basis as the labor retirement reserve, which shall be deposited in the Bank of Taiwan (former Central Trust Of China). When the actual pension is paid, it shall be paid from the special account of the retirement reserve. If there is any shortage, it shall be paid by the Company. In addition, since July 1, 2005, the Company has, in line with the implementation of the Labor Pension Act (hereinafter referred to as the "new system"), allocated the labor retirement reserve for employees who are eligible for the new system, according to their allocation rate of 6% of their monthly wages to the individual labor pension accounts at the Bureau of Labor Insurance, and the allocation amount will be recognized as current expenses. - 2. Current ratio, Quick ratio:
- It is mainly due to the decrease in current liabilities over the same period.
- 3. Interest coverage ratio
- It is mainly due to the increase in interest expense over the same period.
- 4. Pre-Tax Profit to Paid-in Capital Ratio (%):

- 5. Cash flow ratio (%), cash flow adequacy ratio (%), cash reinvestment ratio (%)

It is mainly due to the increase in net cash inflow from operating activities over the same period.

- Note 1:  All financial data from 2018 to 2022 have been audited and attested by the CPAs.
- Note 2:  The cash flow ratio is zero or negative.
- Note 3:  The calculation formulas for the above items of financial analysis data are listed as follows:
- 1. Financial structure
- (1) Debt-to-assets ratio = Total liabilities / Total assets.
- (2) Ratio of long-term capital to property, plant and equipment = (Total equity + Non-current liabilities) / Net property, plant and equipment.

## 2. Solvency

- (1) Current ratio = Current assets / Current liabilities.
- (2) Quick ratio = (Current assets - Inventory - Prepaid expenses) / Current liabilities.
- (3) Interest coverage ratio = Income before tax and interest expenses / Interest expenses.

## 3. Operating Ability

- (1) Receivables (including accounts receivable and notes receivable due to business operations) turnover ratio = Net sales / Balance of average receivables (including accounts receivable and notes receivable due to business operations).
- (2) Average collection days = 365 / Receivables turnover ratio.
- (3) Inventory turnover ratio = Cost of goods sold / Average inventory.
- (4) Payables (including accounts payable and notes payable due to business operations) turnover ratio = Cost of goods sold / Balance of average payables (including accounts payable and notes payable due to business operations).
- (5) Average days for sale = 365 / Inventory turnover ratio.

- (6) Property, plant and equipment turnover ratio = Net sales / Average net property, plant and equipment.
- (7) Total asset turnover ratio = Net sales / Average total assets.

## 4. Profitability

- (1) Return on assets = [Net income after tax + Interest expenses x (1 - Tax rate)] / Average total assets.
- (2) Return on equity = Net income after tax / Average total equity.
- (3) Net profit margin = Net income after tax / Net sales.
- (4) Earnings per share = (Net income attributable to owners of parent company - Dividends on preferred shares) / Weighted average number of shares issued (Note 4).

## 5. Cash Flow

- (1) Cash flow ratio = Net cash flow from operating activities / Current liabilities.
- (2) Net cash flow adequacy ratio = Net cash flow from operating activities for the most recent five years / (Capital expenditures + Inventory increase + Cash dividends) for the most recent five years.
- (3) Cash reinvestment ratio = (Net cash flow from operating activities - Cash dividends) / (Gross property, plant and equipment + Long-term investments + Other non-current assets + Working capital). (Note 5)

## 6. Leverage

- (1) Operating  leverage  =  (Net  operating  income  -  Changes  in  operating  costs  and  expenses)/Operating income (Note 6).
- (2) Financial leverage = Operating income / (Operating income - Interest expenses).
- Note 4:  Special attention shall be paid to the following matters when the above calculation formula for earnings per share is used:
- 1. Use the weighted average number of ordinary shares, not the number of shares issued at the end of the year.
- 2. Capital increase for cash or treasury stock transactions shall be considered when the weighted average number of shares is calculated.
- 3. Capital increase from surplus earnings or capital reserve shall be retrospectively adjusted by the proportion of capital increase when earnings per share for previous annual and semi-annual periods are calculated. The issue period for capital increase does not have to be considered.
- 4. For preferred shares that are non-convertible accumulated preferred shares, dividends (regardless of whether they are distributed) shall be deducted from net income after tax or included as net loss after tax. If preferred shares are non-cumulative, where net income after tax is available, dividends on preferred shares shall be deducted from net income after tax. No adjustment is required if the Company has loss after tax.

## Note 5:  Special attention shall be paid to the following in the process of cash flow analysis:

- 1. Net cash flow from operating activities refers to net cash flow generated from operating activities in the statement of cash flows.
- 2. Capital expenditures refer to the annual cash flow used in capital investment.
- 3. The increase in inventory is included only if the balance at the end of the year is greater than the balance at the beginning of the year. If it is the other way around, the number used should be zero.
- 4. Cash dividends include cash dividends on ordinary shares and preferred shares.
- 5. Gross  property,  plant  and  equipment  refers  to  the  total  value  of  property,  plant  and  equipment  minus accumulated depreciation.
- Note 6:  The issuer shall classify the operating costs and operating expenses as fixed or variable based on their nature. If it involves estimation or subjective judgment, attention shall be paid to its rationality and consistency.
- Note 7:  Where company shares have no par value or where the par value per share is not NT$10, any calculation involving paid-in capital and its ratio shall be replaced with the calculation of the ratio of equity attributable to owners of the parent company in the balance sheet.

Note 3:

- The calculation formulas for the above items of financial analysis data are listed as follows:

## 1. Financial structure

- (1) Debt-to-assets ratio = Total liabilities / Total assets.
- (2) Ratio of long-term capital to property, plant and equipment = (Total equity + Non-current liabilities) / Net property, plant and equipment.

## 2. Solvency

- (1) Current ratio = Current assets / Current liabilities.
- (2) Quick ratio = (Current assets - Inventory - Prepaid expenses) / Current liabilities.
- (3) Interest coverage ratio = Income before tax and interest expenses / Interest expenses.

## 3. Operating Ability

- (1) Receivables (including accounts receivable and notes receivable due to business operations) turnover ratio = Net sales / Balance of average receivables (including accounts receivable and notes receivable due to business operations).
- (2) Average collection days = 365 / Receivables turnover ratio.
- (3) Inventory turnover ratio = Cost of goods sold / Average inventory.
- (4) Payables (including accounts payable and notes payable due to business operations) turnover ratio = Cost of goods sold / Balance of average payables (including accounts payable and notes payable due to business operations).
- (5) Average days for sale = 365 / Inventory turnover ratio.
- (6) Property, plant and equipment turnover ratio = Net sales / Average net property, plant and equipment.
- (7) Total asset turnover ratio = Net sales / Average total assets.

## 4. Profitability

- (1) Return on assets = [Net income after tax + Interest expenses x (1 - Tax rate)] / Average total assets.
- (2) Return on equity = Net income after tax / Average total equity.

- (3) Net profit margin = Net income after tax / Net sales.
- (4) Earnings per share = (Net income attributable to owners of parent company - Dividends on preferred shares) / Weighted average number of shares issued (Note 4).
- 5. Cash Flow
- (1) Cash flow ratio = Net cash flow from operating activities / Current liabilities.
- (2) Net cash flow adequacy ratio = Net cash flow from operating activities for the most recent five years / (Capital expenditures + Inventory increase + Cash dividends) for the most recent five years.
- (3) Cash reinvestment ratio = (Net cash flow from operating activities - Cash dividends) / (Gross property, plant and equipment + Long-term investments + Other non-current assets + Working capital). (Note 5)

## 6. Leverage

- (1) Operating leverage = (Net operating income - Changes in operating costs and expenses)/Operating income (Note 6).
- (2) Financial leverage = Operating income / (Operating income - Interest expenses).
- Note 4:  Special attention shall be paid to the following matters when the above calculation formula for earnings per share is used:
- 1. Use the weighted average number of ordinary shares, not the number of shares issued at the end of the year.
- 2. Capital increase for cash or treasury stock transactions shall be considered when the weighted average number of shares is calculated.
- 3. Capital increase from surplus earnings or capital reserve shall be retrospectively adjusted by the proportion of capital increase when earnings per share for previous annual and semi-annual periods are calculated. The issue period for capital increase does not have to be considered.
- 4. For preferred shares that are non-convertible accumulated preferred shares, dividends (regardless of whether they are distributed) shall be deducted from net income after tax or included as net loss after tax. If preferred shares are non-cumulative, where net income after tax is available, dividends on preferred shares shall be deducted from net income after tax. No adjustment is required if the Company has loss after tax.

Note 5:  Special attention shall be paid to the following in the process of cash flow analysis:

- 1. Net cash flow from operating activities refers to net cash flow generated from operating activities in the statement of cash flows.
- 2. Capital expenditures refer to the annual cash flow used in capital investment.
- 3. The increase in inventory is included only if the balance at the end of the year is greater than the balance at the beginning of the year. If it is the other way around, the number used should be zero.
- 4. Cash dividends include cash dividends on ordinary shares and preferred shares.
- 5. Gross  property,  plant  and  equipment  refers  to  the  total  value  of  property,  plant  and  equipment  minus accumulated depreciation.
- Note 6:  The issuer shall classify the operating costs and operating expenses as fixed or variable based on their nature. If it involves estimation or subjective judgment, attention shall be paid to its rationality and consistency.
- Note 7:  Where company shares have no par value or where the par value per share is not NT$10, any calculation involving paid-in capital and its ratio shall be replaced with the calculation of the ratio of equity attributable to owners of the parent company in the balance sheet.

## (I) Investment Policies

- 1. The Company's long-term investment policy is to increase the core competitiveness, meet customer needs and grasp the future product development of the market, and actively engages in new business areas to pursue breakthrough growth.
- 2. Operate  through  joint  ventures  and  merger  and  acquisition,  actively  look  for  new opportunities, new technologies and new markets to meet customers' One Stop Shopping, so as to expand the business field.
- 3. The Company actively operates the solar power generation plant, promotes the solar energy system development through a joint venture or the establishment of a new company, and owns the  power  plant,  develops  the  inverter  and  other  plan,  and  grasps  the  key  development technology.
- 4. Reinvest in energy sectors, such as energy management, smart grid, energy storage and electric  vehicles,  and  build  core  technologies  through  partnerships  with  partners  or investments in related industries.

## (II) Main Reasons for the Profits/Losses Generated thereby, the Plan for Improving Re-investment Profitability

In recent years, the Company carries out reinvestment actively based on its long-term strategy to seek strategic targets. The Company will continue to provide guidance and support for the affairs required by subsidiaries.

## (III) Investment Plan for the Coming Year:

The  Company  will  continue  to  pay  close  attention  to  market  changes  and  trends  and  make investment  plans  based  on  the  overall  consideration  of  global  production  and  marketing distribution, while investing solely in the way of investment, or seek strategic partners for joint ventures and other strategic alliance modes, in consideration of the technical, manufacturing, business and financial feasibility.

## 2. Changes in Interest Rates

COVID-19 continued to plague the world in 2022, caused several millions of deaths thus far and devastated the global economy. As the inflation concern aggravates, U.S. and Europe successively took on tightening interest policies.    Central Bank of Taiwan has also raised interest rates to tackle inflation.  However,  as  the  Company  and  its  subsidiaries  currently  still  have  a  large  amount  of available bank credits, and the interest rates continue to be adjusted upward with minor changes, the impact on the Company's capital utilization should be limited.

## 3. Changes in Exchange Rate

The exchange rate of Taiwan dollar against the US dollar at the end of 2022 was30.708 dollars, an depreciation of 3.018 dollars (-10.90%) compared with that at the end of 2021, which was favorable to most of the products quoted in US dollars by the Company and its subsidiaries. In order to effectively manage the exchange rate risk, the Company and its subsidiaries try their best to quote in US dollars for purchase and payment, so as to achieve the effect of natural hedging. The Company also has formulated the Operational procedures for Acquisition and Disposal of Assets, with the financial department referring to the analysis of well-known banks and research institutions at home and abroad, to engage in forwarding exchange, exchange rate swaps and other hedging derivative financial commodity trading, so as to reduce the risk of exchange rate fluctuations.

## 4. Inflation

The consumer price index (CPI) and the producer price index (PPI) in Taiwan increased by 2.95% and 10.51%, respectively, in 2022 from 2021. The Company and its subsidiaries raised selling prices accordingly and hence the profits and losses were not materially affected.

AcBel  values  R&D  importance  to  the  future  growth.  Every  year  R&D  spends  over  6%  of consolidated revenue. In 2022, R&D spending reach NT$1.67 billion and accounts for 6.6% of consolidated revenue.

The Company will always pay attention to the changes in political and economic policies and laws at home and abroad and take the initiative to propose corresponding measures. ## (V) Effect on the Company's Financial Operations of Developments in Science and Technology as well as Industrial Change, and Measures to Be Taken in Response

Power  supply  is  changed  toward  miniaturization,  high  density,  high  efficiency,  low  energy consumption, etc. As the industry changes rapidly, the Company always pays attention to adjust the direction of product development, and according to the current market situation of the products and the accumulation of key technologies. ## (VI) Effect on the Company's Crisis Management of Changes in the Corporate Image, and Measures to Be Taken in Response

The Company has a dedicated spokesman to be responsible for the maintenance of relations with the public and investors, the establishment of the Company image. During the current fiscal year up to the date of publication of the annual report, no major incidents have occurred that have affected the corporate image of the Company.

## (VII) Expected  Benefits  and  Possible  Risks  Associated  with  Any  Mergers  and Acquisitions, and Measures to Be Taken in Response

On January 20, 2022, the Company announced the acquisition of 100% share rights of Lineage Power Holdings Inc. - the Power Conversion division of ABB, a leading industrial automation manufacturer, and the transaction is expected to be completed in the second half of 2023.    With respect to sources of the acquisition funding, besides AcBel's own funds, the Company is also planning  to  proceed  with  Follow-On  Offering  (FPO)  acquisition.    And  by  completing  the acquisition, AcBel will not only be able to enter the U.S. telecommunication power market as a result, the percentage of consumer products will also drastically decrease, which will be greatly beneficial for both gross margin and profitability.   In cases of possible future acquisition plans, the Company will carefully assess and consider their merger synergy so to ensure shareholders' rights.

## (VIII) Expected Benefits and Possible Risks Associated with Any Plant Expansion, and Measures to Be Taken in Response

The Company currently has set up seven plants in the whole world, with the daily operation on track. All plants will regularly communicate information with headquarters and other plants to adjust the plant layout in line with the global supply chain adjustment, and make careful evaluation during the transfer process.

## (IX) Risks Associated with Any Consolidation of Sales or Purchasing Operations, and Measures to Be Taken in Response

The raw materials purchased by the Company are based on the principle of simultaneous supply from multiple suppliers.
